tit.cmt: ・タイトルなので大文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 日本髪（にほんがみ）は、広義では古墳時代から昭和戦前までの日本固有の髪形の事。
sen.e: The Japanese coiffure by a broad definition refers to the coiffure unique to Japan from the Tumulus period to the pre-war Showa period.
The Japanese coiffure by a broad definition refers to the coiffure unique to Japan from the Tumulus Period to the pre-war Showa Period.
sen.cmt: ・時代のpを大文字に変更しました。（次項のEdo Periodに合わせるため）
sen.e: The Japanese coiffure by a broad definition refers to the coiffure unique to Japan from the Tumulus Period to the pre-war Showa Period.

sen.j: 狭義の「日本髪」は安土桃山時代後期から幕末までの日本人女性に結われた結髪を指す。
sen.e: "The Japanese coiffure" by a narrow definition refers to the keppatsu (hairdressing) dressed by Japanese women from late Azuchi-Momoyama period to the end of Edo Period.
The Japanese coiffure' by a narrow definition refers to the keppatsu (hairdressing) practiced by Japanese women from the late Azuchi-Momoyama Period to the end of the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: ・仕様によりダブルクォーテーションをシングルに変更しました。・dress the hairdressingとは言わないのでpracticeに変更。・時代名にtheを追加しました。
sen.e: The Japanese coiffure' by a narrow definition refers to the keppatsu (hairdressing) practiced by Japanese women from the late Azuchi-Momoyama Period to the end of the Edo Period.

sen.j: 本項目では日本の髪型の変遷や男性の風俗を分かりやすく示すため、広義にとり、「日本で過去に存在した髪型」の一覧を示した。
sen.e: This section applies a broad definition to make clear the transition of the hairstyle in Japan and dressing customs of men and lists "the hairstyles that existed in the past in Japan."
This section adopts a broad definition to illustrate the transition of the hairstyles in Japan and the dressing customs of men and lists 'the hairstyles that existed in Japan.'
sen.cmt: ・applyは意味が文脈とズレるのでadoptに変更しました。・分かりやすく示すというは、難しいことを説明するというわけではなく、例示するということなのでillustrateを使います。・仕様によりダブルクォーテーションをシングルに変更しました。・in the pastは過去形で表現できるので削除しました。・theを追加しました。注：hairstyleとhair styleに表記が分かれているので、すべてhairstyleに統一しました。（次項以降すべてに当てはまる）
sen.e: This section adopts a broad definition to illustrate the transition of the hairstyles in Japan and the dressing customs of men and lists 'the hairstyles that existed in Japan.'

sen.j: 変遷
sen.e: Transition
Transition
Transition

sen.j: 江戸前期
sen.e: The early Edo period
Early Edo Period
sen.cmt: ・表記統一のためperiodのpを大文字に変更しました。・文章でないため時代のtheは無しで統一します。（以下、同じ）
sen.e: Early Edo Period

sen.j: 男性の髪型は、ひっつめで、後の銀杏髷に近い形が主流。
sen.e: The mainstream of the male hairstyle is hittsumebin (hair pulled tightly back in a bun), whose shape is close to ichomage (a hair-style like a fan, like the leaf of the sacred gingko tree).
The mainstream male hairstyle was Hittsume (hair tightly pulled back in a bun), whose shape was close to Ichomage (a hairstyle like a fan, like a leaf of the sacred gingko tree).
sen.cmt: ・mainstreamを形容詞に変更。・過去形に変更。・日本語は、「ひっつめ」となっているので、英語も合わせます。
sen.e: The mainstream male hairstyle was Hittsume (hair tightly pulled back in a bun), whose shape was close to Ichomage (a hairstyle like a fan, like a leaf of the sacred gingko tree).

sen.j: 女性の髪型は立兵庫、元禄島田、元禄勝山、等、細長い髪型が主流。
sen.e: The mainstreams of the female hairstyle are long and narrow hairstyles such as Tatehyogo, Genrokushimada, and Genrokukatsuyama.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The mainstream female hairstyles were long and narrow hairstyles such as Tatehyogo, Genrokushimada, and Genrokukatsuyama.
sen.cmt: ・mainstreamを形容詞に変更。・過去形に変更。
sen.e: The mainstream female hairstyles were long and narrow hairstyles such as Tatehyogo, Genrokushimada, and Genrokukatsuyama.

sen.j: 髱も、鴎髱、鶺鴒髱、等、後ろに突き出す形が流行した。
sen.e: The popular styles of tabo (back part) were Kamome-zuto (a women's hair style) and Sekirei-tabo (a women's hair style), in which hair protrudes backward.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The popular styles of tabo (back part) were the ones the form of which protruded backward such as Kamome-zuto (women's hairstyle similar to the gull's tail) and Sekirei-tabo (women's hairstyle similar to the wagtail's tail).
sen.cmt: ・文型を前項に合わせて変更。・過去形に変更。・髱名に説明を追加しました。
sen.e: The popular styles of tabo (back part) were the ones the form of which protruded backward such as Kamome-zuto (women's hairstyle similar to the gull's tail) and Sekirei-tabo (women's hairstyle similar to the wagtail's tail).

sen.j: 江戸中期
sen.e: Mid Edo period
Mid-Edo Period
sen.cmt: ・ハイフンを追加・pを他項に合わせて大文字に変更しました。
sen.e: Mid-Edo Period

sen.j: 男性の髪型は本多髷が主流。
sen.e: The mainstream of the male hairstyle was Honda mage.
The mainstream of the male hairstyle was Honda mage.
The mainstream of the male hairstyle was Honda mage.

sen.j: 女性の髪型は灯籠鬢という、横に張り出し、透けた感じの鬢が主流になった。
sen.e: The mainstream of the female hairstyle was toro-bin, a style having sideburns protruding in the both side and looking as if it can be seen through.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The mainstream of the female hairstyle was Toro-bin, a style that has sideburns protruding to both sides and that can be seen through.
sen.cmt: ・他項に合わせて、髪型名は大文字から始めるように変更しました。・この文脈でlook as ifはおかしいので、省きました。
sen.e: The mainstream of the female hairstyle was Toro-bin, a style that has sideburns protruding to both sides and that can be seen through.

sen.j: 髷も島田髷や勝山 (遊女)など横に広くて大きい髷になる一方、髱の方は後ではなく下の方に膨らむようになり、この頃から抜き衣紋が行われるようになった。
sen.e: The mage (chignon) became larger and wider as seen in Shimada-mage and Katsuyama (yujo (a prostitute)), while the sideburns became more puffed up downward, which made the style of nukiemon (pulled back collar) popular at the time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Mage (chignon) became larger and wider as seen in Shimada-mage and Katsuyama (for yujo [prostitutes]), while sideburns became more puffed up downward, which introduced nukiemon (pulled back collar) at this time.
sen.cmt: ・Theを省きました。・forを追加、仕様により丸括弧内の括弧を角括弧に変更、prostituteを複数に変更。・抜き衣紋は、髪型ではないので、styleは省きました。・行われるようになった、というのは、導入され始めたということなのでintroduceを使用します。・theをthisに変更しました。
sen.e: Mage (chignon) became larger and wider as seen in Shimada-mage and Katsuyama (for yujo [prostitutes]), while sideburns became more puffed up downward, which introduced nukiemon (pulled back collar) at this time.

sen.j: 江戸後期
sen.e: Later Edo Period
Late Edo Period
sen.cmt: ・他項に合わせてtheを追加。・後期は他項でlateになっているので、lateで統一します。
sen.e: Late Edo Period

sen.j: 男性の髪型は再び銀杏髷が主流で、女性同様に鬢を膨らませた厚鬢になった。
sen.e: The mainstream of the male hairstyle was ichomage, a style in which hair is puffed up into thick sideburns like its women's style.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The mainstream of the male hairstyle was Ichomage again, the style of which had puffed and thick sideburns like women's.
sen.cmt: ・再びのagainを追加。・which節を簡潔に変更。
sen.e: The mainstream of the male hairstyle was Ichomage again, the style of which had puffed and thick sideburns like women's.

sen.j: 町人の場合は袋付という、下に膨らませた髱が主流になった(但し男性は抜き衣紋をしない)。
sen.e: Among townspeople, the mainstream of their sideburns was Fukurotsuki, a style in which hair is puffed up downward (although nukimon style was not worn by men).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Among townspeople, tabo puffed out downward, called Fukurotsuki, was prevailing (although men did not practice nukiemon).
sen.cmt: ・鬢ではなく髱についてなので、sideburnsを削除して、書き直しました。・抜き衣紋はぬきえもんと読むようです。
sen.e: Among townspeople, tabo puffed out downward, called Fukurotsuki, was prevailing (although men did not practice nukiemon).

sen.j: 女性の髪型は灯籠鬢の流行が下火になったが、高島田、つぶし島田、結綿、桃割れ、丸髷、先笄、等、ほぼ現行の髪型が、この時期に定着した。
sen.e: As for the female hairstyle, the popularity of toro-bin declined and almost current styles--such as takashimada (decorative female wig), tsubushi shimada (the hair style worn by young unmarried women, courtesans and geisha), yuiwata (hair style like cotton wrapped up), momoware (literally, split peach; female hair style in kimono that the bun is split and a red fabric woven in the center), Marumage (rounded hair style of a married woman), and sakikogai (a variation of Shimada knot with the remaining hair is arranged with a stick called "kogai")--took root at the time.

As for the female hairstyles, the popularity of Toro-bin declined, and the hairstyles almost same as the current ones, such as the following, took root in these days: Takashimada (a decorative female wig), Tsubushi shimada (a hairstyle worn by young unmarried women, courtesans and geisha), Yuiwata (a hairstyle like cotton wrapped up), Momoware (literally, split peach; a female hairstyle in kimono in which the bun is split and a red fabric is woven in the center), Marumage (a rounded hairstyle for married women), and Sakikogai (a variation of the Shimada knot with remaining hair arranged with a stick called "kogai").
sen.cmt: ・髪型名を大文字から始めるように変更しました。・the挿入、関係代名詞等修正しました。
sen.e: As for the female hairstyles, the popularity of Toro-bin declined, and the hairstyles almost same as the current ones, such as the following, took root in these days: Takashimada (a decorative female wig), Tsubushi shimada (a hairstyle worn by young unmarried women, courtesans and geisha), Yuiwata (a hairstyle like cotton wrapped up), Momoware (literally, split peach; a female hairstyle in kimono in which the bun is split and a red fabric is woven in the center), Marumage (a rounded hairstyle for married women), and Sakikogai (a variation of the Shimada knot with remaining hair arranged with a stick called "kogai").

sen.j: 髱は、公家、大名家では椎茸髱が主流となった。
sen.e: The Shiitake-tabo (palace women's hair style) became the mainstream of their tabo among the kuge (court noble) and Daimyo family (feudal lord family).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Speaking of tabo, among kuge (court nobles) and daimyo families (feudal lord families), Shiitake-tabo (palace women's hairstyle) became their mainstream.
sen.cmt: ・theを省いたり、複数にしたり、文章構造を少し変えました。
sen.e: Speaking of tabo, among kuge (court nobles) and daimyo families (feudal lord families), Shiitake-tabo (palace women's hairstyle) became their mainstream.

sen.j: 一般武家、町人は、関東では下に膨らませる、関西では、少しだけ、丸く膨らませるのが主流になった。
sen.e: Among common samurai family and townspeople. the mainstream in Kanto region was a style in which hair is puffed up downward and that in Kansai region was a style in which hair is a little rolled up.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Among common samurai families and townspeople, tabo was generally puffed out downward in the Kanto region and puffed a little round in the Kansai region.
sen.cmt: ・この項は、上項からの続きで髱の話なので文章を書き換えました。・ピリオドをコンマに変更。・familyを複数形に変更。・地方名にtheをつけました。
sen.e: Among common samurai families and townspeople, tabo was generally puffed out downward in the Kanto region and puffed a little round in the Kansai region.

sen.j: 明治～昭和戦前
sen.e: Meiji Period to pre-war in Showa Period
From Meiji Period to pre-war Showa Period
sen.cmt: ・pre-warは形容詞なので変更しました。
sen.e: From Meiji Period to pre-war Showa Period

sen.j: 洋風化の影響で、男性は殆どが洋髪となった。
sen.e: Under the influence of westernization, most men started to have western hair style.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Under the influence of westernization, most men started to have the western hairstyles.
Under the influence of westernization, most men started to have the western hairstyles.

sen.j: 女性の場合は洋風の髪型が登場し始めた一方で、折衷ともいえる、束髪、夜会巻き、耳隠し、行方不明髷、等の洋服、和服双方に合う髪型も考案された。
sen.e: In women's hair style, the western style emerged, while hair styles regarded as a blending--Sokuhatsu (Western hairdo), Yakaimaki (a bun hairdo which was popular in the Meiji period), Mimikakushi (a bun hairdo which was popular in the Taisho period), Yukuefumei mage (a bun hairdo without a topknot), and so on--were worked out so as to suit both western and Japanese clothes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: With regard to the women's hairstyles, the western styles emerged on one hand, but on the other hand hairstyles that can be said to be hybrids between traditional styles and western styles, such as the followings, were invented to suit both western and Japanese clothes: Sokuhatsu (western hairdo), Yakaimaki (a bun hairdo which was popular in the Meiji Period), Mimikakushi (a bun hairdo which was popular in the Taisho Period), Yukuefumei mage (a bun hairdo without a topknot), and so on.
sen.cmt: ・例示を後ろにもってくるために、文を変更しました。・westernを他項に合わせて小文字にしました。・periodを他項に合わせて大文字にしました。・work outは口語的なので、変更しました。
sen.e: With regard to the women's hairstyles, the western styles emerged on one hand, but on the other hand hairstyles that can be said to be hybrids between traditional styles and western styles, such as the followings, were invented to suit both western and Japanese clothes: Sokuhatsu (western hairdo), Yakaimaki (a bun hairdo which was popular in the Meiji Period), Mimikakushi (a bun hairdo which was popular in the Taisho Period), Yukuefumei mage (a bun hairdo without a topknot), and so on.

sen.j: 二百三高地髷（にひゃくさんこうちまげ）は、日露戦争後に日本で流行した髪形で、前髪を張り出すとともに頭頂部に束ねた髪を高くまとめていた。
sen.e: In Nihyakusankochi-mage, a hair style popular after the Russo-Japanese War, hair on the top front of the head protruded forward and hair tied at the top was arranged upward.
Nihyakusankochi-mage, which was a popular hairstyle after the Russo-Japanese War, had forward protruding hair on the top front of the head and high tied hair at the top.
sen.cmt: ・動詞がよく分からない文になっていたので、文章の形を変えました。
sen.e: Nihyakusankochi-mage, which was a popular hairstyle after the Russo-Japanese War, had forward protruding hair on the top front of the head and high tied hair at the top.

sen.j: 当時普及し始めていた洋装にも合う髪型として生み出され、流行した。
sen.e: This style was worked out and became popular as a hairstyle that suits the spreading western clothes at the time.
This style was invented to suit western closes that began to spread at this time and became popular.
sen.cmt: ・work outは口語的なので変更しました。・時制は過去で統一しました。
sen.e: This style was invented to suit western closes that began to spread at this time and became popular.

sen.j: ラヂオ巻きなどモダンな名称の洋髪も生み出された。
sen.e: Other western hair styles having a modern name--such as radio maki--were also worked out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The hairstyles in the western style with modern names such as Radio maki were also invented.
The hairstyles in the western style with modern names such as Radio maki were also invented.

sen.j: 戦時体制に入るまでは和服の場合に限り従来の日本髪(と、白塗りの厚化粧)も依然として結われた。
sen.e: Before the establishment of the wartime regime, the traditional Japanese coiffure was still dressed (along with thick makeups like Shironuri (white makeup)) only when people worn Japanese style clothes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Before the wartime regime was established, the traditional Japanese coiffures were still worn (along with thick makeup like Shironuri [white makeup]) only when women wore Japanese clothes.
sen.cmt: ・動詞を使ったほうがよりよいので変更しました。・dressは髪を整えることなので、wearを使用します。・仕様により括弧内の括弧を角括弧に変更。・化粧をするのは女性なので、womenに変更。・動詞をworeに変更。・styleは不要です。
sen.e: Before the wartime regime was established, the traditional Japanese coiffures were still worn (along with thick makeup like Shironuri [white makeup]) only when women wore Japanese clothes.

sen.j: 戦後以降
sen.e: After post war period
After the post-war period
After the post-war period

sen.j: 日本髪文化は歌舞伎、時代劇、花柳界、結婚産業以外では殆ど衰退したが現在では正月等の晴れ着の場合に新日本髪を結う場合が多い。
sen.e: Although the Japanese coiffure culture almost declined except for in Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors), period dramas, the karyukai (world of the geisha), and the wedding industry, people today often dress the new Japanese coiffure when wearing haregi (festive dress) in New Year's day and other occasions.

Although the Japanese coiffure culture almost perished except in kabuki (the traditional drama performed by male actors), period dramas, karyukai (the world of geisha), and the wedding industry, people today usually dress the new Japanese coiffure when wearing haregi (festive dress) in New Year's day and other occasions.
sen.cmt: ・almost declinedだったらまだ衰退していないので単語を変更。・except forの後は名詞が来ることが望ましいと思うので、exceptに変更。・Kabukiを小文字に変更。・kabukiというのは日本特有のdramaなのでtheを挿入。
sen.e: Although the Japanese coiffure culture almost perished except in kabuki (the traditional drama performed by male actors), period dramas, karyukai (the world of geisha), and the wedding industry, people today usually dress the new Japanese coiffure when wearing haregi (festive dress) in New Year's day and other occasions.

sen.j: 江戸と上方
sen.e: Edo and Kyoto prefecture and vicinity
Edo and kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka area)
sen.cmt: ・江戸と京都府を同列にするのはおかしいので、括弧書きにしました。括弧内はデータベースより。少なくともthe vicinityです。
sen.e: Edo and kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka area)

sen.j: 江戸風
sen.e: Edo style
Edo style
Edo style

sen.j: 前髪と鬢は前の方に突き出す。
sen.e: Hair on the top front of the head and sideburns protruded forward.
The hair on the top front of a head and the sideburns protruded forward.
sen.cmt: ・江戸風の髪のことなので、theを挿入しました。
sen.e: The hair on the top front of a head and the sideburns protruded forward.

sen.j: 髱は下の方に突き出す。
sen.e: The tabo protruded downward.
The tabo protruded downward.
The tabo protruded downward.

sen.j: かもじを多く使うので重くなる傾向がある。
sen.e: The hair tended to be heavier because many kamoji (hairpieces) was used.
The hair tended to be heavier because many kamoji (hairpieces) were used.
sen.cmt: ・manyがついているので、可算名詞であり、be動詞を複数形にしました。
sen.e: The hair tended to be heavier because many kamoji (hairpieces) were used.

sen.j: 全体的に大ぶりになる。
sen.e: The hair became rather large as a whole.
The hair was large as a whole.
sen.cmt: ・手順を説明して、こうなったっていうことじゃないので、「であった」という意味のbe動詞の過去でいい。むしろとかかなりという意味ではないので、ratherは不要だと思います。
sen.e: The hair was large as a whole.

sen.j: 上方風
sen.e: Kamigata style
Kamigata style
Kamigata style

sen.j: 前髪と鬢は前の方に突き出さずに後ろの方に自然に流す。
sen.e: Hair on the top front of the head and sideburns did not protrude forward but naturally flowed backward..
The hair on the top front of a head and the sideburns did not protrude forward but naturally flowed backward.
sen.cmt: ・上方風の髪型のことなので、theを追加しました。
sen.e: The hair on the top front of a head and the sideburns did not protrude forward but naturally flowed backward.

sen.j: 髱は丸く納める。
sen.e: The tabo was rolled up.
The tabo was rolled up.
The tabo was rolled up.

sen.j: かもじを最小限に使うので軽くなる傾向がある。
sen.e: It tended to be lighter because a minimum number of kamoji (hairpieces) was used.
The hair tended to be lighter because a minimum number of kamoji (hairpieces) were used.
sen.cmt: ・上項に合わせて、変更しました。
sen.e: The hair tended to be lighter because a minimum number of kamoji (hairpieces) were used.

sen.j: 前から見ると小振りで丸っこい感じなので可憐な感じになる。
sen.e: The hair style gave an impression of cuteness because it looked small and round from the front.
The hairstyle gave an impression of cuteness because it looked small and round when looked at from the front.
sen.cmt: ・つながりをよくするために、whenを挿入。
sen.e: The hairstyle gave an impression of cuteness because it looked small and round when looked at from the front.

sen.j: 系統別
sen.e: By category
By category
By category

sen.j: ※少女：第二次性徴前、妙齢：第二次性徴後の未婚、既婚：18歳以上の未婚を含む場合有り
sen.e: *Girls: before the secondary sex characteristic, Adolescence: unmarried women after the secondary sex characteristic, married women: include unmarried women aged 18 or older.
*Girls: before the secondary sex characteristics; Young women: unmarried women after the secondary sex characteristics; Married women: possibly include unmarried women aged 18 or older
sen.cmt: ・※をアスタリスクに変更しました。・characteristicを複数形に変更しました。・adolescentは男女両方であるため、変更しました。・コンマをセミコロンに変更しました。・セミコロン後はすべて大文字に変更しました。・ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: 垂髪系
sen.e: Long flowing hair style
Long flowing hairstyles
Long flowing hairstyles

sen.j: 垂髪(平安中期～室町、公家、武家→現代花嫁)
sen.e: Long flowing hair (the mid Heian to Muromachi Period, kuge, samurai family => modern bride)
Long flowing hair (From mid-Heian to Muromachi Periods; Worn by, originally, kuge and the samurai families, and now modern brides)

sen.e: Long flowing hair (From mid-Heian to Muromachi Periods; Worn by, originally, kuge and the samurai families, and now modern brides)

sen.j: 下げ髪(江戸中期～後期、大名家既婚)

sen.cmt: ・他項に合わせて主語を追加しました。・前割れと書いてあるので、eにしました。・髪を分けるはpartを使うようです。
sen.e: Gakuyaicho: This hairstyle was also called Hawase or Maeware, where hair is parted in the middle without making the forelock stand up.

sen.j: 髷は銀杏返しと同じ。
sen.e: It has a mage similar to ichogaeshi.
It had the same mage as the one of Ichogaeshi.
sen.cmt: ・「同じ」なのでsameを使用するように変更しました。・髪型名は大文字で始めるように変更しました。
sen.e: It had the same mage as the one of Ichogaeshi.

sen.j: 元々は歌舞伎の女形の日常の髪型。
sen.e: It was originally a daily hair style of Kabuki actors of female roles.
It was originally a hairstyle for the daily use of kabuki actors who took female roles.
sen.cmt: ・daily hairstyleは分かりにくいので変えました。
sen.e: It was originally a hairstyle for the daily use of kabuki actors who took female roles.

sen.j: 現代では舞踊の素踊りで女性が男役を踊るときの髪型。
sen.e: It is now a hair style dressed by a maiko when she plays a male role in suodori (dancing without costume and hairpiece).
Today it is worn when a woman plays a male role in the dance of suodori (dancing without costume and hairpiece).
sen.cmt: ・日本語に合わせて文章を改変しました。
sen.e: Today it is worn when a woman plays a male role in the dance of suodori (dancing without costume and hairpiece).

sen.j: 貝髷（ばいまげ）：巻貝に似せた縦長の髷。
sen.e: Bai-mage: a vertically oriented mage that is made to imitate the bai mage.
Bai-mage: A vertically long topknot imitating a spiral shell.
sen.cmt: ・文章を分かりやすく変えました。
sen.e: Bai-mage: A vertically long topknot imitating a spiral shell.

sen.j: 女太夫(鳥追い)等、大道芸人の髪型。
sen.e: Onnadayu (tori oi) and so forth: a hair style of a street performer
A hairstyle of street performers such as onnadayu (torioi).
sen.cmt: ・元がまったくおかしいので、文章を改変しました。
sen.e: A hairstyle of street performers such as onnadayu (torioi).

sen.j: 貝蝶々（ばいちょうちょう）：貝髷と銀杏返しを合成した髪型。
sen.e: Baichocho: a hair style--a mixture between bai-mage and Ichogaeshi
Baichouchou: A mixture hairstyle of Bai-mage and Ichogaeshi.
sen.cmt: ・「ちょうちょう」の読みを仕様に合わせてuを追加。・後に文が続くので、文章形に変更しました。
sen.e: Baichouchou: A mixture hairstyle of Bai-mage and Ichogaeshi.

sen.j: 天神髷とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Tenjinmage.
It was also called Tenjinmage.
It was also called Tenjinmage.

sen.j: 上記と同様の大道芸人の髪型。
sen.e: It is also a hair style of a street performer like the above.
A hairstyle of street performers like the above.
sen.cmt: ・同じ始まりの文が続くので、変更しました。
sen.e: A hairstyle of street performers like the above.

sen.j: 千日鬘：実際の髪形ではなく芝居の髪形で盗賊役などが結う。
sen.e: Sennichi-bin: It is not a hairstyle for everyday life but is worn by an actor who plays a thief in a drama.
Sennichi-bin: This hairstyle was not for everyday life but was worn by actors who played a role like a thief in dramas.
sen.cmt: ・個々の髪型をまずthis hairstyleで受けるように変更しました。
sen.e: Sennichi-bin: This hairstyle was not for everyday life but was worn by actors who played a role like a thief in dramas.

sen.j: 浪人などが月代を伸ばしっぱなしにしているもの。
sen.e: It is a style in which a ronin(masterless samurai)let his hair grow in his sakayaki (shaved part of the forehead).
This hairstyle was gained when a ronin (masterless samurai)let his sakayaki (the shaved part of the forehead) grow.
sen.cmt: ・文章を分かりやすく改変しました。
sen.e: This hairstyle was gained when a ronin (masterless samurai)let his sakayaki (the shaved part of the forehead) grow.
